page.title: 11NARROW GAUGE RAILWAY :NEW
page.content:
Following the major rail strike in 1955 and closure of the main line sidings in 1969, the sand traffic was diverted to road.
In 1967 a society was formed to protect the line. It now operates 3 steam engines and a number of diesel locomotives.
The oldest steam locomotive'Challoner' is a 1877 vertical boiler 0-4-0 built to work in the North Wales slate quarries. The second locomotive 'Rishra' is a 0-4-0 Baguley built in 1920 and brought back from India in early 1970s. The largest is a 0-6-0 woodburner brought back from Africa, Built in 1936 by Orenstein & Koppel.
Operating at weekends the line carries over 10,000 people each year.
